p: Some of these processes concern subsistence economies and local commerce, alternative health practices, oral and hands-on learning, and other practices, mostly considered outdated or “primitive” nowadays by the modern-development mindset. Otherwise, from a post-development and intercultural perspective, based on the Buen Vivir paradigm, within which nature and society are inseparable and the utmost respect for Pachamama (Mother Nature) is required, they reveal that human well-being and intergenerational sustainability can be achieved without endangering Earth’s biodiversity, including ourselves.
